course.subject: ISDN
course.name: Mechatronic Systems Design with Embedded Computing
course.description: The special topic course provides an introductory experience into the design of mechatronic systems and the corresponding controller using embedded computing platform. The course includes fundamental theory and also practical hands-on labs and projects for the student to acquire the basic knowledge of designing mechatronic systems. In the lab sessions, students design and build a succession of mechatronic subsystems, leading to an integrated system in a final project. Lectures topics include embedded system design, basic electronics, use of sensors and actuators, system modelling, measurement and control, and appreciation of how mechatronic systems solve real-world problems. Instructor's approval is required.
course.exclusions: ELEC 1100, MECH 2907

reviews.author: LongLong
reviews.title: Good course with an acceptable workload
reviews.comment_content:
Lecture 1A - Introduction to Mechatronics Design
Lecture 1B - Introduction to Embedded Computing and Electronics
Lecture 2 - Energy Power and Power Source
Lecture 3 - Digital Logics
Lecture 4 - Embedded System
Lecture 5 - Interface and Interrupt
Lecture 6A - Mobile Robotics
Lecture 6B - Degrees of Freedom
Lecture 6C - Couting Degrees of Freedom
Lecture 7 Mobile Robot Sensing
Lecture 8 Mobile Robot Actuation
Lecture 9 Mobile Robot Kinematics

2 written assignments
Mid-term exam
No final exam
Final project
reviews.comment_teaching:
The course is co-taught by Prof. Song and Prof. Leung. The TA is Ming Chan. The student TA is Alex Wong.

Good teaching with supportive and knowledgeable TAs to provide extra support after lessons.
reviews.comment_grading: I got an A at the end.
reviews.comment_workload:
A little bit of self-reading is needed regarding RC filter and their decay behaviour.
At the end, students need to make a self-balancing robot as an individual project. Some knowhow in Arduino programming and basic electronics knowledge is a plus.
